meanings.definition: Not provided with an endowment or gift.
meanings.sent1: The unendowed charity struggled to support its cause.
meanings.sent2: She felt unendowed with the necessary resources to succeed.
meanings.sent3: The unendowed birthday present was a rock wrapped in newspaper.
meanings.sent4: His unendowed garden bloomed with wildflowers of all colors.
meanings.sent5: The unendowed student relied on hard work to achieve success.

meanings.sent1: The unendowed singer struggled to carry a tune.
meanings.sent2: He felt unendowed in sports but excelled in academics.
meanings.sent3: The unendowed chef burned water while attempting to cook.
meanings.sent4: Her unendowed creativity blossomed after taking an art class.
meanings.sent5: The unendowed actor forgot his lines during the entire play.
